question: what does judgment as a matter of law mean
answers: Judgment as a matter of law (JMOL) is a motion made by a party, during trial, claiming the opposing party has insufficient evidence to reasonably support its case.

positive_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
positive_ctxs.text: Judgment as a matter of law (JMOL) is a motion made by a party, during trial, claiming the opposing party has insufficient evidence to reasonably support its case.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: JMOL is also known as a directed verdict , which it has replaced in American Federal courts.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: JMOL is similar to judgment on the pleadings and summary judgment , all of which test the factual sufficiency of a claim.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: Judgment on the pleadings is a motion made after pleading and before discovery ; summary judgment happens after discovery and before trial; JMOL occurs during trial.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: In United States federal courts , JMOL is a creation of Federal Rules of Civil Procedure Rule 50.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: JMOL is decided by the standard of whether a reasonable jury could find in favor of the party opposing the JMOL motion.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: If there is no evidence to support a reasonable conclusion for the opposing party, judgment is entered by the court and the case is over.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: If there is sufficient evidence to make a reasonable conclusion in favor of the opposing party, but there is equally strong evidence to support an opposite conclusion, the party with the burden of persuasion fails.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: Timing is very important in making a motion for JMOL; the motion can only be made once the opposing party has presented its case.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: In civil cases, the plaintiff presents her case, then the defendant presents his/her case, then the plaintiff may present a rebuttal .

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: So, once the plaintiff has presented his/her case, the defendant may move for JMOL, but the plaintiff may not.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: Once the defendant has finished presenting his/her case, the plaintiff may move for JMOL, and so may the defendant.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: JMOL motions may also be made after the verdict is returned, where they are called "renewed" motions for judgment as a matter of law (RJMOL), but the motion is still commonly known by its former name, judgment notwithstanding verdict , or j.n.o.v. (from the English judgment and the Latin non obstante veredicto).

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: However, in order to move for j.n.o.v., the movant must have moved for a JMOL before the verdict as well.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: This procedural quirk is necessary because it is considered a violation of the 7th amendment for a judge to overturn a jury verdict.

negative_ctxs.title: Judgment as a matter of law
negative_ctxs.text: Instead, the judge is said in a j.n.o.v. to be reexamining not the verdict, but his previous rejection of JMOL.

question: How Works Diaphragm Pump
answers: A diaphragm pump (also known as a Membrane pump, Air Operated Double Diaphragm Pump (AODD) or Pneumatic Diaphragm Pump) is a positive displacement pump that uses a combination of the reciprocating action of a rubber , thermoplastic or teflon diaphragm and suitable valves either side of the diaphragm ( check valve , butterfly valves, flap valves, or any other form of shut-off valves) to pump a fluid .

positive_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
positive_ctxs.text: A diaphragm pump (also known as a Membrane pump, Air Operated Double Diaphragm Pump (AODD) or Pneumatic Diaphragm Pump) is a positive displacement pump that uses a combination of the reciprocating action of a rubber , thermoplastic or teflon diaphragm and suitable valves either side of the diaphragm ( check valve , butterfly valves, flap valves, or any other form of shut-off valves) to pump a fluid .

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: Diaphragm pump schematic.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: There are three main types of diaphragm pumps:

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: Those in which the diaphragm is sealed with one side in the fluid to be pumped, and the other in air or hydraulic fluid .

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: The diaphragm is flexed, causing the volume of the pump chamber to increase and decrease.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: A pair of non-return check valves prevent reverse flow of the fluid.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: Those employing volumetric positive displacement where the prime mover of the diaphragm is electro-mechanical, working through a crank or geared motor drive, or purely mechanical, such as with a lever or handle.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: This method flexes the diaphragm through simple mechanical action, and one side of the diaphragm is open to air.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: Those employing one or more unsealed diaphragms with the fluid to be pumped on both sides.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: The diaphragm(s) again are flexed, causing the volume to change.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: When the volume of a chamber of either type of pump is increased (the diaphragm moving up), the pressure decreases, and fluid is drawn into the chamber.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: When the chamber pressure later increases from decreased volume (the diaphragm moving down), the fluid previously drawn in is forced out.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: Finally, the diaphragm moving up once again draws fluid into the chamber, completing the cycle.

negative_ctxs.title: Diaphragm pump
negative_ctxs.text: This action is similar to that of the cylinder in an internal combustion engine .

negative_ctxs.text: In political philosophy the social contract or political contract is a theory or model, originating during the Age of Enlightenment , that typically addresses the questions of the origin of society and the legitimacy of the authority of the state over the individual .

negative_ctxs.title: Social contract
negative_ctxs.text: Social contract arguments typically posit that individuals have consented, either explicitly or tacitly, to surrender some of their freedoms and submit to the authority of the ruler or magistrate (or to the decision of a majority), in exchange for protection of their remaining rights .

negative_ctxs.title: Social contract
negative_ctxs.text: The starting point for most social contract theories is a heuristic examination of the human condition absent from any political order that Thomas Hobbes termed the “ state of nature ”.

negative_ctxs.title: Social contract

negative_ctxs.title: Social contract

negative_ctxs.text: Each solved the problem of political authority in a different way.

negative_ctxs.title: Social contract
negative_ctxs.text: Locke believed that natural rights were inalienable, and that the rule of God therefore superseded government authority; and Rousseau believed that democracy (self-rule) was the best way of ensuring the general welfare while maintaining individual freedom under the rule of law.

negative_ctxs.text: The Lockean concept of the social contract was invoked in the United States Declaration of Independence .
